data.title: cross compiling 1.7 for Android in Windows fails
data.body:
1) android_ndk and path are set correctly
2) at command prompt, type:

`d:\Urho3D-1.7-prototype>cmake_android.bat ..\builds\android_1.7 -DANDROID_TOOLCHAIN_NAME=x86-4.9
`

**It starts out OK - it's able to find the toolchain:**
```
-- Check for working C compiler: C:/Android/android-ndk-r15c/toolchains/x86-4.9/prebuilt/windows-x86_64/bin/i686-linux-android-gcc.exe
-- Check for working C compiler: C:/Android/android-ndk-r15c/toolchains/x86-4.9/prebuilt/windows-x86_64/bin/i686-linux-android-gcc.exe -- works
-- Detecting C compiler ABI info
-- Detecting C compiler ABI info - done
-- Detecting C compile features
-- Detecting C compile features - done
-- Check for working CXX compiler: C:/Android/android-ndk-r15c/toolchains/x86-4.9/prebuilt/windows-x86_64/bin/i686-linux-android-g++.exe
-- Check for working CXX compiler: C:/Android/android-ndk-r15c/toolchains/x86-4.9/prebuilt/windows-x86_64/bin/i686-linux-android-g++.exe -- works
```
**SDL2 config options:**
```
-- SDL2 was configured with the following options:
--
-- Platform: Android-1
-- 64-bit:   FALSE
-- Compiler: C:/Android/android-ndk-r15c/toolchains/x86-4.9/prebuilt/windows-x86_64/bin/i686-linux-android-gcc.exe

```

**then it errors out with:**
```
-- Performing Test HAVE_NATIVE_COMPILER
-- Performing Test HAVE_NATIVE_COMPILER - Failed
CMake Error at CMake/Modules/CheckCompilerToolchain.cmake:134 (message):
  Could not find native compiler toolchain.  This is usually caused by wrong
  PATH env-var value.

  CMake Error in CMakeLists.txt:

    No CMAKE_C_COMPILER could be found.

    Tell CMake where to find the compiler by setting either the environment
    variable "CC" or the CMake cache entry CMAKE_C_COMPILER to the full path to
    to the compiler, or to the compiler name if it is in the PATH.

Call Stack (most recent call first):
  Source/Urho3D/CMakeLists.txt:198 (check_native_compiler_exist)

```
**I have also tried this with the x86_64-4.9 toolchain in a clean build tree, and that also fails with the same error.**

Edit: added the last bit of error info.

My vs2015's Freetype project includes/compiles/links the md5.c, just don't understand why the md5.h is not copied.

data.title: Incorrect normals on Cylinder.mdl?
data.body:
The shading on these cylinders doesn't look right:

![cylinders](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/252111/29465504-2b479626-83ff-11e7-8117-79c2e4cb45a6.jpeg)

These are the built-in Cylinder.mdl, basic white material with a directional light. Per-vertex light so it's easier to see what's going on.

I would expect each facet of the cylinder to have flat shading along its length, as the top and bottom edges should have the same normals, but instead the facets have bright and dark ends.

data.title: 3D UI
data.body:
This change adds support for rendering GUI into a texture. This is achieved by adding `UIComponent` component to `Node`. `UIComponent` overrides material of `Node`'s `StaticModel`. UI subsystem is changed so that batches belonging to UI elements owned by `UIComponent` are rendered into a texture that is also contained in `UIComponent`. Input is handled by UI subsystem, so anything that worked on normal UI will work on UI rendered on to 3D object. This required a minor change for input handling. Previously "screen" was considered surface of entire window. Now screen is considered area of `root_element_position` + `root_element_size`. This is fully backwards-compatible.

There is one issue i am unable to solve: since on OpenGL texture coordinates start from bottom-left corner a workaround is needed. Texture is flipped by projection matrix, however it breaks scissor test. I do not know how to properly fix it therefore scissor test is disabled when rendering into texture on OpenGL. Issue is clearly visible when scrolling a `ListView` in `HelloGUI` sample when UI is rendered on to a cube. Any help regarding OpenGL issue would be greatly appreciated.

Other changes: lua and angelscript bindings, HelloGUI sample can toggle between rendering on screen or rendering on cube, added a ListView to HelloGUI sample window.

![screen](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19151258/29453889-c245ce12-83fa-11e7-93be-3f29c34b5f25.png)

data.title: SIGINT ignored on linux in headless mode
data.body:
When launching an application in headless mode, pressing CTRL-C does nothing. What I'd expect to happen is the E_EXITREQUESTED event to be sent.

I haven't looked into this in great detail, but it seems that the place to start investigating is in SDL. It appears that the SDL_QUIT event is not generated when pressing CTRL-C.

data.title: PBR on a model without tangents
data.body:
See the attached scene. The model is rendered incorrectly, an error occurs: "Failed to create input layout for shader PBRLitSolid(IBL) due to missing vertex element(s) (HRESULT 80070057)".
I suppose the problem is that the PBR shader tries to use tangents, although in fact they are not required. Tangents and bitangents are passed to the 'ImageBasedLighting' function, but not used in it.

[pbr_tangents_bug.zip](https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/files/1227032/pbr_tangents_bug.zip)

data.title: IK documentation
data.body: As the title says.

data.title: Relative paths
data.body:
I've added relative path support to the ResourceCache. Main changes are nodes now storing their base paths, the mechanism for accessing the base paths, and the addition of a basePath parameter to GetResource functions.
Note that this breaks the existing API -- I added the base path parameter after the filename, before the `bool sendEventOnFailure`. This could be done the other way around, but I feel that it is more logical this way, and encourages users to actually pass a basePath parameter.
Also, there are a few things left to do -- JSON loading does not get a base path (see the added `#warning` notes), and how it is handled with scripts also needs to be decided -- is it relative to the script instances's path or to the node that hold's the instance? (See the added `//TODO:` comments).
Also, the actual resolving of the relative paths onto the base path may not be as efficient as it could be -- I've not tested it, but I reason that it is not done often enough that it would be a priority for optimizing now, unless someone else finds otherwise.

data.title: IKEffector target bug fix
data.body:
This should fix the "(0,0,0) effector" bug.

IKEffector can either explicitly be given a target position with ```SetTargetPosition()```, or it can be given a node name to "follow", in which case IKEffector will search the scene for a matching node name right before solving.

The problem was that it would still perform this search, even with an empty node name. This behaviour is clearly wrong.

data.title: Current working directory as default resource prefix path instead of executable path
data.body:
In the `InitializeResourceCache` method of the engine class the default resource prefix path is set as the executable path through `FileSystem::GetProgramDir()` . A side effect of this is that running any Urho3D program through a path that doesn't contain "Data" and "CoreData" folder, even after setting the current working dir to a folder that contains them, throws up the path prefix warning prompt. 
This happens while trying to run an app directly through an IDE after building  (noticed in QtCreator and Codeblocks).

I know that you can resolve this by setting `ResourcePrefixPaths` value of the engine parameter to your current working directory. However, If there is no specific reason why `FileSystem::GetProgramDir()` is used as default value instead of `FileSystem::GetCurrentDir()` then I believe setting it as the later wouldn't be bad. At least to make some IDEs happy :grin:

data.title: Iss2058
data.body:
This PR contains the following changes:
  - It's now possible to have IKSolver components that share the same subtrees ([#2058](https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/issues/2058)).
  - Urho avoids the call to abort() by not calling ik_solver_solve() if the tree is invalid.
  - Fixed a bug in solver_FABRIK_solve() where the root position was incorrectly being set to the original root node position instead of the active root node position. This bug made it impossible to move the root node if USE_ORIGINAL_POSE was disabled.
  - Added a chain tree iterator, which allows Urho to iterate over only the nodes that are affected by the solver instead of having to iterate over all nodes in the tree.
  - The scripting API for SetFeature()/GetFeature() was changed, such that now you can write ```solver.FEATURE_NAME = true``` directly, instead of having to type ```solver.SetFeature(IKFeature.FEATURE_NAME, true)```
  - Updating/Adding docstrings.

There are still two changes I'd like to get in before the 1.7 release. I believe I am onto what's causing the 0,0,0 effector bug, see my thread on more details here: https://discourse.urho3d.io/t/inverse-kinematics/1819/90

data.title: OffMeshConnection-s don't work sometimes
IKSolver should ignore child IKSolver components
data.body:
As discussed here: https://discourse.urho3d.io/t/inverse-kinematics-mass-instances/3405/23

It should be possible to have multiple solvers in a skeleton, where one solver can potentially be in a parent solver's subtree. In this case, the parent solver's tree should end at the node the child solver is attached to.

data.title: No such file or directory for all my headers project
data.body:
Hi all. 
My IDE Code Blocks, i use mingw w64.

When compiling my project, I get an error: No such file or directory. For all my headers.

structure project:
```
Root folder.
    Bin
        Autoload
        CoreData
        Data
    CMake
        Modules
        Toolchains
    WTGame.CPP
    version.h
```

My CMakelists

```
# Set project name
project (WTGame)
######################################
# Set CMake minimum version and CMake policy required by Urho3D-CMake-common module
if (WIN32)
    cmake_minimum_required (VERSION 3.2.3)      # Going forward all platforms will use this as minimum version
else ()
    cmake_minimum_required (VERSION 2.8.6)
endif ()
if (COMMAND cmake_policy)
    cmake_policy (SET CMP0003 NEW)
    if (CMAKE_VERSION VERSION_GREATER 2.8.12 OR CMAKE_VERSION VERSION_EQUAL 2.8.12)
        # INTERFACE_LINK_LIBRARIES defines the link interface
        cmake_policy (SET CMP0022 NEW)
    endif ()
    if (CMAKE_VERSION VERSION_GREATER 3.0.0 OR CMAKE_VERSION VERSION_EQUAL 3.0.0)
        # Disallow use of the LOCATION target property - so we set to OLD as we still need it
        cmake_policy (SET CMP0026 OLD)
        # MACOSX_RPATH is enabled by default
        cmake_policy (SET CMP0042 NEW)
	cmake_policy (SET CMP0063 OLD)
    endif ()
endif ()
# Set CMake modules search path
set (CMAKE_MODULE_PATH ${CMAKE_SOURCE_DIR}/CMake/Modules)
# Include Urho3D Cmake common module
include (UrhoCommon)
# Define source files
define_source_files (RECURSE)
# Define target name
set (TARGET_NAME WTGame)
# Setup target with resource copying
setup_main_executable ()
```
Here are the lines.

![errors](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13874433/28870752-1900c284-778a-11e7-83fc-b11f0116dd41.PNG)
![errors1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13874433/28870794-42373598-778a-11e7-985a-1d8c2fd9f111.PNG)
![errors2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13874433/28870751-18d9c9c2-778a-11e7-976f-c10bcbd8dbb0.PNG)
![errors3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13874433/28870750-18d734e6-778a-11e7-8b21-950bde66a32b.PNG)

I'm already in despair..
Thank you so much!

data.title: Strange behavior and crash in 39_CrowdNavigation.as sample
data.body:
I was playing with crowd navigation sample. These jacks are somewhy unable to climb on the boxes by off-mesh. If I move the jack on the connection first, it climbs successfully. If I don't, it "stucks".

When I spawned a lot of jacks and asked them to climb, the jacks started to stuck and at some point I got a crash in the debug renderer:

```
Urho3DPlayer_d.exe!Urho3D::CrowdManager::DrawDebugGeometry(Urho3D::DebugRenderer * debug, bool depthTest) Line 153
Urho3DPlayer_d.exe!Urho3D::CrowdManager::DrawDebugGeometry(bool depthTest) Line 190
```

`ag->params.userData ` somewhy was zero.

**Update**: broken climbing is caused by #1695 fix in `CrowdAgent::OnMarkedDirty`

data.title: File::Tell() and relative File::Seek()
data.body: File should support relative seeking. I'm currently using it to read data from a binary format and need to be able to skip over blocks of data.

data.title: FindUrho3D.cmake fails with custom install location
data.body:
On my 64-bit Gentoo linux machine I tried installing Urho3D to ```/usr/urho3d```. libUrho3D.so is then located under ```/usr/urho3d/lib64/Urho3D/libUrho3D.so```

This call to ```find_library()``` fails:
```cmake
find_library (URHO3D_LIBRARIES NAMES Urho3D ${URHO3D_LIB_SEARCH_HINT} PATH_SUFFIXES ${PATH_SUFFIX} ${SEARCH_OPT} DOC "Urho3D library directory")
```

If I rename the ```lib64``` directory to ```lib```, it works. So I think there's an issue with cmake not testing for lib64 folders on my machine.
